Heap memory allocation is slow - finding some bigger memory block in system is slow
C++ usually use for industries like gaming etc which requires fast speed
*** we can use any manipulator with file streams
//open file or create it if not exist for writing
getline(fin, line); //read a line from a file
fin>>word; //read a word from a file
//(char*)& --> going to mem and take whatever is in the record
int* a; //a in a pointer to int
int b = *a; //the value of a pointing to, assign it to b
int& c = d; //c is a reference to d
int somefunction(int& param); //this is the only time you see as reference
fin.read(&firstName, 20); //read 20 chars from a file to firstName
fout.write(firstName, 20); //write 20 chars of firstName to a file
usually used to go back to a position we remembered by using tellp()/tellg()
go to location 5 bytes b4 the end of the file
//get the position of the write pointer
fout.seekp(20, ios_base::cur); //20 bytes after the current position
//get the position of the read pointer
fin.seekg(-10, iso_base::end); //10bytes b4 the end of the file
Private is the default access control
Vector* b = new Vetor(); //Creating on heap memory(slow)
function calls and return work in this memory
no need to free/delete the memory
stack-allocated memory is "gone" when going out of scope
retuired size for variables and parameters are know during compile time
have to find an empty continuous memory block
programmers have to free/delete the memory
cin >> number; //abc  which failed to read, number have whatever it had b4
if you can use reference use it, only use pointer when you need to move address around / output parameter use pointer
Called when an object is deleted
Memory MUST be manually cleaned up in destructor
